page.title: 07Farming in Alstonefield
page.content: We have about 108 acres and one big wooden shed. It is big enough to hold all our cows and calves because it has 90 cubicles. The shed's full length is 60 by 45 feet. As well as the 70 beef cattle, we have 150 Swaledale ewes and 60 mule hogs. The cows are mostly Friesian crossed with Angus and we also have Herefords and Simmenthal with a Charolais bull. The land is both hilly and flat and has not needed to be drained. About half of the land on the farm is used for silage and hay to feed the cattle in winter. All the hilly land is used for either sheep or young stock grazing. All the rest of the land is used for fodder and beef cattle. The land that has the qualities for crop growing is used for fodder and beef cattle grazing.
